subject: Re: [junit] Help plz...
msgSnippet: Chan Could be that your TestLanguageVector.class is not of type test, else try to cast it and see what happens. This soltion is purely based on the error
messageBody:
Chan

Could be that your TestLanguageVector.class is not
of type test, else try to cast it and see what
happens.
This soltion is purely based on the error message.

Gowda

--- Chan <chanduram@...> wrote:
> Hi,
> I Changed my Test suite() method to :
>
> public static Test suite(){
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);
> return suite;
>
> Its giving the following compile time error :
>
> TestLanguageVector.java:25:
> addTest(junit.framework.Test) in
> junit.framework.TestSuite cannot be applied to
> (java.lang.Class)
> suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);
>
> What does this say, how should i proceed ...
>
> Regds
> chan
>
>
>
> On Tuesday 16 September 2003 8:33 pm, Jason Rogers
> wrote:
> > Your suite() method is wrong. It should say:
> >
> > public static Test suite(){
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> > suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);
> > return suite;
> > }
> >
> > What exception is thrown when you give another
> index (other than 2)?
> >
> > =jason
> >
> > On Tue, 2003-09-16 at 06:22, Chan wrote:
> > > Hi,
> > >
> > > Just go thro this program, it does not run for
> negative test
> > > and how must the runtime bug must be fixed.
> > >
> > > Plz suggest me a solution.
> > >
> > > regards
> > > chandu
> > >
> > > /* LanguageVector.java
> > > */
> > > /* Proram that stores that adds element in
> Vector
> > > inserts a element at a specified position and
> displays */
> > >
> > > import java.util.*;
> > > import java.io.*;
> > > class LanguageVector
> > > {
> > > static Vector list = new Vector();
> > > static int length;
> > > public static void main(String args[])
> > > {
> > > length= args.length;
> > > System.out.println("The size args.length
> ="+length);
> > > for (int i=0; i<length ; i++)
> > > {
> > > list.addElement(args[i]);
> > > }
> > > list.insertElementAt("COBOL",2);
> > > int size= list.size();
> > > System.out.println("The size list.size()
> ="+size);
> > > String listArray[]=new String[size];
> > > list.copyInto(listArray);
> > > System.out.println("List of Languages");
> > > for (int i=0; i<size ; i++)
> > > {
> > > System.out.println(listArray[i]);
> > > }
> > >
> > > }
> > > }
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > /* Test Program TestLanguageVector.java*/
> > > /* This programs fails when i run a negative
> test. Plz go thro the
> > > comments i have typed */
> > >
> > >
> > > import junit.framework.*;
> > > import java.util.*;
> > > import java.io.*;
> > > class TestLanguageVector extends TestCase {
> > > LanguageVector langvect =new LanguageVector();
> > > public void testlangvect(){
> > > System.out.println("value of
> langvect.length"+langvect.length);
> > > assertEquals(2,langvect.length);
> > > /* the assert fails when i give other value than
> 2, and the program
> > > throws exception and stops, the next assertion
> is not tested and no
> > > FALIURE mssg is given.*/
> > >
> assertEquals("COBOL",langvect.list.elementAt(2));
> > > }
> > >
> > > public static Test suite(){
> > > return new
> TestSuite("TestLanguageVector.class");
> > > }
> > >
> > >
> > > public static void main(String args[])
> > > {
> > >
> > > String params[] = {"TOMCAT","EJB"};
> > > /*I passs parameters to the main () of
> LanguageVector.java */
> > > LanguageVector.main(params);
> > > /*1.If the below two stmts are not added
> the testlangvect() is not
> > > getting innitaited */
> > > /*2. If I run negative test the Faliure msg is
> not displayed
> > > the program stops after throwing the first
> Exception */
> > >
> > > TestLanguageVector testlangVector= new
> TestLanguageVector();
> > > testlangVector.testlangvect();
> > >
> > > junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
> > > System.out.println("Test Stmt");
> > > }
> > > }
> > >
